title: Listening and Following Directions

vocab.definition: Instructions that tell you what to do
To pay careful attention to what you hear
To do what the directions say
The order that things should be done

teachingNotes: Start with one-step directions, then build to multi-step. Use gestures and visual cues. Practice with classroom routines.

sample.question: When your teacher gives directions, what should you do first?

truefalse.question: Good listeners look at the person talking.
expectedAny: looking shows you are paying attention

multiplechoice.question: If directions say 'First draw a circle, then color it red,' what do you do first?
expectedAny: the directions say to draw a circle first

fillintheblank.question: To follow directions well, you need to _____ carefully.

shortanswer.question: What should you do if you don't understand the directions?
